Hi
Im using
Heritrix 1.14.3
Win XP pro sp2
java v6

Im using the following =
script to initiate the crawler. There hasnt been any issue launching it in =
the browser and signing into it. Thanks

title Heritrix
set HERITRIX_HOME=
=3DC:\heritrix-1.14.3
cd "C:\heritrix-1.14.3"

set classpath=3D%HERITRIX_HO=
ME%\heritrix-1.14.3.jar;%HERITRIX_HOME%\lib\ant-1.6.2.jar;%HERITRIX_HOME%\l=
ib\bsh-2.0b4.jar;%HERITRIX_HOME%\lib\commons-cli-1.0.jar;%HERITRIX_HOME%\li=
b\commons-codec-1.3.jar;%HERITRIX_HOME%\lib\commons-collections-3.1.jar;%HE=
RITRIX_HOME%\lib\commons-httpclient-3.1.jar;%HERITRIX_HOME%\lib\commons-io-=
1.3.1.jar;%HERITRIX_HOME%\lib\commons-lang-2.3.jar;%HERITRIX_HOME%\lib\comm=
ons-logging-1.0.4.jar;%HERITRIX_HOME%\lib\commons-net-1.4.1.jar;%HERITRIX_H=
OME%\lib\commons-pool-1.3.jar;%HERITRIX_HOME%\lib\dnsjava-2.0.3.jar;%HERITR=
IX_HOME%\lib\fastutil-5.0.3-heritrix-subset-1.0.jar;%HERITRIX_HOME%\lib\ite=
xt-1.2.0.jar;%HERITRIX_HOME%\lib\jasper-compiler-tomcat-4.1.30.jar;%HERITRI=
X_HOME%\lib\jasper-runtime-tomcat-4.1.30.jar;%HERITRIX_HOME%\lib\javaswf-CV=
S-SNAPSHOT-1.jar;%HERITRIX_HOME%\lib\je-3.3.75.jar;%HERITRIX_HOME%\lib\jeri=
cho-html-2.6.jar;%HERITRIX_HOME%\lib\jets3t-0.5.0.jar;%HERITRIX_HOME%\lib\j=
etty-4.2.23.jar;%HERITRIX_HOME%\lib\junit-3.8.2.jar;%HERITRIX_HOME%\lib\lib=
idn-0.5.9.jar;%HERITRIX_HOME%\lib\mg4j-1.0.1.jar;%HERITRIX_HOME%\lib\poi-2.=
0-RC1-20031102.jar;%HERITRIX_HOME%\lib\poi-scratchpad-2.0-RC1-20031102.jar;=
%HERITRIX_HOME%\lib\servlet-tomcat-4.1.30.jar

java -Xmx512m org.archive.cr=
awler.Heritrix --admin=3Dadmin:changeme

From: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com [archive-crawler@yahoogroup=
s.com] On Behalf Of Gordon Mohr [gojomo@...]
Sent: 03 April 2009 22=
:41
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Fris=
t crawl job issues

What is your...

- Heritrix version
- Operating System
=
- Java version

...and how are you launching Heritrix?

There have been a n=
umber of reports of similar problems at times; they
may have gone away for =
people when they either updated their launch
script (on Windows) or moved a=
way from GCJ (on Linux).

See for example:

http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/gr=
oup/archive-crawler/message/3383
http://webteam.archive.org/jira/browse/HER=
-472

If there's a change in the distribution we can make to better
work-ar=
ound this issue, I'd like to know.

- Gordon @ IA
